MS 12521 Victorian Horticultural Society records, box 3401, p. 63, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

[October 1860]
editorial addition. MS written into minutes at meeting of 29 October 1860.

I am instructed by the Committee of the Victorian Gardeners' Mutual Improvement Society to request that you will contribute towards the exhibition to be held in connection with the Society as per enclosed schedule
Schedule has not been found. on the 22d and 23d of Novr by sending plants &c in the same liberal way which you have hitherto done to the Horticultural Society. The committee ventures to hope that you will the more readily accord your support on this occasion as the G. M. I. Soc is not backed up by Government grants of money and large annual subscriptions but is getting up this its first show at its own cost and not with any view to rival the Horti Soc
Horticultural Society of Victoria. but from a sincere desire to promote Horticulture and to encourage a taste for Horticultural pursuits on the part of the working classes who are from the highly fashionable character which the shows of the Horti Soc. has assumed as it were excluded from enjoying the benefits and recreation to be derived at Exhibitions of Horticultural produce
